reviewText: Excellent makes you feel like your at the concert
Mozart is in my top 5 of all time! Thank you!
Great musical performances at a bargain price

This is a DVD box set of Mozart music covering instrumental, orchestra, chamber, choral music, and opera. Out of the five disks of the set, four were released as an individual product in the past. Disc 1. A Mozart Gala from Prague / Sharon Kam, Manfred Honeck, Czech Philharmonic Orchestra * Don Giovanni Overture, K.527 * Concerto for Clarinet and Orchestra in A major, K.622 * Symphony No. 38 in D major, K.504 "Prague" Disc 2. Mozart - Symphony No. 41, Piano Concerto No. 20, Divertimento K.113, Hartmut Haenchen * Divertimento in E flat major, K .113 * Concerto for Piano and Orchestra No. 20 in D minor, K.466 * Symphony No. 41 in C major, K.551 "Jupiter" Disc 3. Mozart Violin Sonatas - Gil Shaham, Orli Shaham [Region 2 * Sonata for Piano and Violin in G major, K.301, * Sonata for Piano and Violin in E flat major, K.302, * Sonata for Piano and Violin in C major, K.303, * Sonata for Piano and Violin in E minor, K.304, * Sonata for Piano and Violin in A major, K.305, * Sonata for Piano and Violin in D major, K.306 Disc 4. Wiener Sangerknaben: A Mozart Celebration from the Stephansdom * Church Sonata in C major, K.278 * "Credo" from the Mass in C minor, K.427 * "Et incarnatus est" from the Mass in C minor, K.427 * Graduale "Sancta Maria, mater Dei", K.273 * "Laudate Dominum" from Vesperae Solennes de Confessore, K.339 * Coronation Mass in C major, K.317, Ave verum corpus, K.618 * "Agnus Dei" from Litaniae Lauretanae, K.195, Church Sonata in C major, K.329 Disc 5 is a modern interpretation of Cos fan tutte, staged in the 1970s. For the current price, I give 4 stars because you can buy fist 4 discs separately and can find better DVD of Cisi fan tutte elsewhere. Mozart - Cosi fan Tutte Mozart - Cosi fan Tutte
